content: mary jo bayliss/&knits salty ear/neck warmer ********* what does salt do it melts things this is a quick beginner friendly knit done up in a lofty worsted weight yarn held double i use light blue for the main color and deep red for the contrast color for your own color choices i encourage you to lead with your feelings hot pink and bright red would also rock link for color work directions are in the pattern because of the longish-floats i recommend using a non-super wash yarn i used blue sky fibers woolstock and it s super soft and cozy for me salt is an acronym for stitches against legalistic terror however it could also stand for sweethearts are leading transformation or in a truly salty acronym s*ck a** looneytoons treble_crochet*mp what would your salty acronym be so many possibilities any stitches are good stitches and in the current climate snitches get stitches doesn t mean what it did to our parents chinga la migra 1 copyright &knits 2026 process materials mc 1 50g 123 yd blue sky fibers woolstok worsted in thermal spring cc 1 50g 123 yd blue sky fibers woolstok worsted in red rock worsted weight yarn held double throughout you may substitute any lofty woolen spun worsted or chunky weight yarn avoid super wash and worsted spun yarns us8 16 and 24 circular needles us8 dpn s or 32 circular needle for magic loop 5 stitch markers tapestry needle gauge 18 stitches and 24 rounds=4 stockinette after blocking please knit a test swatch the finished garment is 22 around and 6 wide after blocking notes if you want tighter ribbing go down a needle size you may go up a needle size for a larger garment without affecting the look of the lettering using a 24 cable should help keep your gauge ok with the color work make sure you soak and block your ear/neck warmer after you weave in the ends it really makes a difference for the better abbreviations mc main color bor beginning of round pm place marker bor m beginning of round marker sm slip marker cc contrast color st stitches k knit k2tog knit 2 together m marker ssk slip slip knit 2 copyright &knits 2026 directions on shorter needle cast on 96 stitches in cc using a long tail cast here s a great article by tin can knits about colorwork if you ve on if you wish a long tail tubular cast on cast on looks great never done it before colorwork intro it covers all the bases color choices gauge blocking etc join for knitting in the round being careful not to twist stitches place bor m and switch to mc k one row of 1x1 ribbing starting with a knit stitch repeat 4x for 5 row total this should
